text: The scope of Symbolics.jl is to be a CAS. If it's in SymPy (and not related to the SciML numerical problems, like ODEs), then it's in Symbolics.jl.

elements.text: The scope of Symbolics.jl is to be a CAS. If it's in SymPy (and not related to the SciML numerical problems, like ODEs), then it's in Symbolics.jl.

but is not yet stable right?

text:
It's "stable". It literally split off from ModelingToolkit this week.

<https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-symbolics-jl-a-modern-computer-algebra-system-for-a-modern-language/56251>

A lot of the code was from MTK so it all worked, but if you see how the MTK docs changed, there was a weird mixture of "part CAS part modeling framework" before, and now it's solely focused on the modeling framework in MTK and the CAS is its own whole world.

elements.text: It's "stable". It literally split off from ModelingToolkit this week.

A lot of the code was from MTK so it all worked, but if you see how the MTK docs changed, there was a weird mixture of "part CAS part modeling framework" before, and now it's solely focused on the modeling framework in MTK and the CAS is its own whole world.

text: So it's not brand new code, but brand new organization that makes the documentation make more sense.

elements.text: So it's not brand new code, but brand new organization that makes the documentation make more sense.

text: Hopefully in a year or two it's just like, "SymPy acts like X so I know how to use it in higher level package Y", it should be "Symbolics.jl is a standard CAS in Julia that I know how to use, and I make use of it as part of MTK".

elements.text: Hopefully in a year or two it's just like, "SymPy acts like X so I know how to use it in higher level package Y", it should be "Symbolics.jl is a standard CAS in Julia that I know how to use, and I make use of it as part of MTK".
